main event: Two military personnel witnessed a bright bluish-white light resembling the planet Venus but with a constant brightness, size approximately twice as large as the brightest star, and no noticeable variation in brightness.
interesting points: The object moved at a high speed and made tight turns, and it appeared to be intelligently controlled.
It hovered for approximately 15 to 30 seconds and was observed fish-tailing at a drastically reduced speed.
The observers tried to call the field control tower but could not reach anyone.
The witnesses were familiar with conventional aircraft lights and were certain that the object was not a conventional aircraft or meteor.
Surrounding area noise level was exceptionally quiet, and the object emitted no audible noise.
sighted object: bright bluish-white light resembling the planet Venus
witnesses: S/Sgt Dale E. McCombs, AF-15455537, Hq. Sq Sect, 635th Air Base Wing, and PFC Charles E. Brown, U.S. Army, Serial No. RA-18376191
